From Brazil to Japan (2007)

Directed by Aaron Litvin and Ana Paula Hirano Litvin

Since 1990 more than 300,000 Brazilians have gone from Brazil to Japan to work, forming a wave of migration that has had a profound social and economic impact on both countries. The transnational documentary "From Brazil to Japan" closely follows five families of Brazilian migrants over the course of three years, from their preparation for departure in Brazil to their adaptation to life and work in Japan.

Co-sponsored with the Edwin O. Reischauer Institute of Japanese Studies at Harvard University
